name: reminiscently
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If you do something reminiscently, you do it while remembering a particular person, event, or thing: He smiled reminiscently when I mentioned the steam trains that used to run on the line. "We used to go on family camping trips to that lake," she said reminiscently.
More examplesFewer examplesHe gazed into the distance for a moment and then continued, reminiscently, to describe the house where he had lived as a child.She picked up the old textbook and began reminiscently to turn the pages.She nodded reminiscently throughout a TV programme about the 1960s.
